So I made a thing to check the progression on mass for life support for number of kerbals and days in flight:

[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ewlbEVwGbxUke23M84C7ZUU5vieG7yIFLovNLY5hz-o/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ewlbEVwGbxUke23M84C7ZUU5vieG7yIFLovNLY5hz-o/edit?usp=sharing)

I did not factor in additional scientists for the MPL, are they required for the recycler?

Edit: I seem to slightly disagree with [https://github.com/BobPalmer/USI-LS/wiki/Most-Efficient-Mass](https://github.com/BobPalmer/USI-LS/wiki/Most-Efficient-Mass) where I see the break even between just supplies and using a greenhouse at 35days instead of 29.

So my station in Kerbin orbit ran out of power, so my agroponics module went kerplunk and my 2 scientists ate up all the supplies. I didn't notice it for awhile so when I checked in they were "refusing to work". I docked a small ship with some huge solar panels and more supplies and got everything back up and running 100% but now I get these messages constantly

"blah blah kermin is refusing to work"

"blah blah kermin has returned to duty"

"blah blah kermin is refusing to work"

"blah blah kermin has returned to duty"

It just spams that over and over continuously. I can still EVA the kerbals in the station, but as soon as they go back in the messages keep going.  KSP 1.1 with USI-LS and MKS Lite! via Ckan (up to date as of 11am EST this morning). I have all the USI Mods installed aside from MKS/OKS.
@brocko - Thanks, will see what I can do to repro this.

Unrelated.  A couple of new things are being worked.

First - a unified settings menu and a single settings file.

Second.  A new (and separate) parts pack that builds a set of generic parts to work with USI-LS - Fertilizer generators, habitats, and a new greenhouse model or two.  The idea is that this will be a pack that can be used stand-alone, or dovetail right into MKS-Lite or UKS ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> On 4/23/2016 at 6:11 AM, Grumman said:
> 
> 
> It sounds like it's working as intended. Your confusion is a result of two things: You have zero time and zero supplies left *before you hit your 15 day reserve* (USI-LS gives you 15 days of virtual supplies instead of demanding you stick a supply canister on every single craft you launch), and you also have infinite time because you're still on Kerbin - your Kerbals are basically being fed from the KSC's stores instead of the craft's stores while you wait for launch.
>

Things like living space, medical care, etc. being taken into account. Is there some place I can find a wiki or manual that explains the way the system works NOW, instead of years ago? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
